question.text: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> are both Lewis acids and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> is stronger than <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math>

Both <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> are Lewis acids and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> is stronger than <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math>

Both <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> are equally strong Lewis acids

Both <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> are not Lewis acids

solution.text: In <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi></math> back-donation occurs between the vacant 2p-orbital of 'B' and fully-filled 3p-orbital of Cl of a <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math> bond. This <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi></math> overlapping is not much effective, because of dissimilar sizes of 2p and 3p-orbitals. But in <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> , <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">π</mi></math> overlapping is more effective, because p-orbitals of Al and Cl belongs to the same energy levels and hence, they are of similar sizes. As a result of back-donation, the electron-deficiency of Al atom gets more compensated as compared with 'B' in <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> and therefore, Lewis acid character of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> is lesser than that of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> .
